channel.title: Good News Network
channel.description: A Daily Dose of Positive News to Enthuse

item.title: Son’s Essay Moves Stranger to Buy Family a Wheelchair-Ready Van
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A Michigan mother was stunned when she got a phone call telling her a complete stranger was buying her a new wheelchair accessible van–and it’s all thanks to her son’s essay praising his deserving mom. Michelle Garn had been struggling to start her van so she could get it to

The post Son’s Essay Moves Stranger to Buy Family a Wheelchair-Ready Van appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Great-Grandma Delivers Bag Lunches to Feed 200 Needy Kids Every Day
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
When this great-grandmother found out kids in her county could go hungry over the summer, she decided to feed all 200 of them — every day. The school district in Gray’s Harbor County, Washington, didn’t have money to provide free or reduced price meals to low income kids over the

The post Great-Grandma Delivers Bag Lunches to Feed 200 Needy Kids Every Day appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: “Friends for Life” Connects Caring People To Lonely Seniors In Need
item.dc:creator: Inez Russell
item.description:
In the United States, more than 11 million senior citizens live alone. Everyone should have someone in their world who cares, and that’s what our group Friends For Life is all about: people taking time to care for the elderly living alone, or in nursing homes who have no visitors. We demonstrate that people

The post “Friends for Life” Connects Caring People To Lonely Seniors In Need appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Rate of Uninsured Hits New Low as More Americans Get Health Coverage
item.dc:creator: Linda Hernandez
item.description:
A new study shows more Americans have health insurance than ever before. According to the latest quarterly Gallup poll, the rate of uninsured adults is down to 11.4 percent. That number represents an almost 5-percent drop since the Affordable Care Act mandate took effect at the start of 2014, when an

The post Rate of Uninsured Hits New Low as More Americans Get Health Coverage appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Barber Gives Free Haircuts to Kids If They Read Stories to Him
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
It’s a deal you can’t beat — an Iowa barber traded free haircuts to kids if they would read to him while in his chair. Courtney Holmes says he wanted to help kids read more — and because of that, he got an earful about proper nutrition from 9-year-old customer

The post Barber Gives Free Haircuts to Kids If They Read Stories to Him appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Town Installs Outdoor Refrigerator so Locals Can Feed the Hungry in Spain
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
People in the Basque town of Galdakao, Spain, put their leftovers in the fridge — not just the ones in their homes, but the one on the street, too. The city of about 30,000 created the country’s first communal refrigerator to help the hungry. Alvaro Saiz, who used to run

The post Town Installs Outdoor Refrigerator so Locals Can Feed the Hungry in Spain appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Padres Baseball Team Keeps Disabled Pitcher on Payroll for 20 Yrs to Give Insurance
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
When folks say a ball team has a lot of heart, they usually mean that, win or lose, the players give it their all, every single time. For the past 20 years, though, the San Diego Padres have been showing their heart through the quiet stroke of a pen in

The post Padres Baseball Team Keeps Disabled Pitcher on Payroll for 20 Yrs to Give Insurance appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 14
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Happy 70th Birthday to the musician, actor, comedian Steve Martin, who, according to Comedy Central, is the 6th best stand-up comic of all time. On top of five Grammys, an Emmy Award and Kennedy Center Honor, he just learned he would receive the International Bluegrass Music’s Distinguished Achievement award for his bluegrass

The post Good News in History, August 14 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Sign Up This Ball Girl Who Made Amazing Catch During Game (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
It was the Major League Baseball play of the day — but the athlete wasn’t even on a team. A San Diego Padres ball girl casually snatched a ripping foul ball out of the air before it could fly into the stands, then nonchalantly tossed it to a kid in

The post Sign Up This Ball Girl Who Made Amazing Catch During Game (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 101-Year-Old Woman Rappels Down Skyscrapers for Charity (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
At 101-years-old, Doris Long occupies herself with charity work — defined as rappelling down the sides of skyscrapers to raise money for others. Her latest descent was down the side of the 560-feet tall Spinnaker Tower in Portsmouth, England to support a hospice in her hometown of Waterlooville. It’s the

The post 101-Year-Old Woman Rappels Down Skyscrapers for Charity (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Young Woman Approaches Elder Eating Alone, Now Have Weekly Lunch Date
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Many of us have been there: we see a senior citizen eating alone and think, maybe I should go talk to them, or sit with them…but we’re not sure what the response will be. Brooke Oacha of  Texas,  decided it was worth a try—and the elderly lady sitting at the “table

The post Young Woman Approaches Elder Eating Alone, Now Have Weekly Lunch Date appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Woman Helps Pet Owners in Poverty and Her Program is Now in 28 States
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
A lot of attention is paid to helping pets get adopted—but one woman saw a need to help furry ones who already had homes. Amanda Arrington, North Carolina State Director for the Humane Society, started the Pets For Life program to provide care and information for pet owners who are sometimes 20 miles away from a

The post Woman Helps Pet Owners in Poverty and Her Program is Now in 28 States appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Astronauts Grow Salad Greens, Eat Fresh Food in Space, a NASA First
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Astronaut cuisine has always consisted mainly of freeze-dried foods, but now a freshly grown vegetable garden is taking off. Astronauts aboard the International Space Station tweeted their excitement Sunday about an off-planet first: the next day’s menu would include veggies grown on board. “Fun watching these (salad greens) grow,” astronaut Kjell Lindgren tweeted, as

The post Astronauts Grow Salad Greens, Eat Fresh Food in Space, a NASA First appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Survival Rates for Ovarian Cancer Reach All Time High – Up 50%
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Women today are far more likely to survive ovarian cancer than their mothers’ would have been. After comparing the survival rate of women diagnosed with ovarian cancer between 1975 and 2011, researchers found that women diagnosed in 2006 or later were 50% less likely to die from the disease than

The post Survival Rates for Ovarian Cancer Reach All Time High – Up 50% appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 13
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
155 years ago today, Annie Oakley, who became the first American woman “superstar,” was born in a cabin in rural Darke County, Ohio. Phoebe Annie Mosey began hunting and trapping at age eight to support her five siblings and widowed mother. She sold the game until her skill eventually paid

The post Good News in History, August 13 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Americans Can Donate AC Units to Seniors Who Can’t Afford Repairs
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Instead of roasting in the oppressive heat of a Mississippi summer, an 81-year-old woman is breathing easier thanks to a donated air conditioner. It’s more than just a cool thing to do. Donating an air conditioner, new or used, can save someone’s life. John Armstrong of the Harrison County Senior Resource

The post Americans Can Donate AC Units to Seniors Who Can’t Afford Repairs appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Stranger Pays Parking Ticket for Mother Staying with Baby at Hospital
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
The last thing an Australian woman needed after spending days in the hospital with her sick, infant son was a parking ticket. Fortunately, a stranger felt the same way. When the mother returned to her car—after days of sitting up with her nine-week-old son in the hospital—she found a note

The post Stranger Pays Parking Ticket for Mother Staying with Baby at Hospital appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 6-yo Boy Who Lost Both Parents Has New Purpose: Making Strangers Smile (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Jaden Hayes lost his father when he was only four, and his mother earlier this year. But the six-year-old is tired of being sad—and seeing everyone sad all the time–so he is cheering up strangers in his hometown. The adorably outspoken child asked his new guardian, Aunt Barbara, to help him

The post 6-yo Boy Who Lost Both Parents Has New Purpose: Making Strangers Smile (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: It’s Unanimous: Every Country in the UN Signs Agreement to Protect Wildlife
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
In an international body where it seems no one gets along, the United Nations has found something everyone likes – wild animals. It took three-years, but all 193 member countries of the U.N. have signed on to a resolution to create new and stronger protections for the world’s wildlife. Baby

The post It’s Unanimous: Every Country in the UN Signs Agreement to Protect Wildlife appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Precious “Lost” Tolkien Story to be Published For the First Time
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
“Not all those who wander are lost” — and not all lost manuscripts stay that way. Fans of “The Hobbit” and “Lord of the Rings” have a new book to look forward to — one that J.R.R. Tolkien wrote more than 100 years ago. It was his first fantasy work

The post Precious “Lost” Tolkien Story to be Published For the First Time appeared first on Good News Network.
